intro: Jasione megalocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered Jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes carnations and other flowering plants. The plant features erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Jasione megalocalyx is typically found in grassy areas and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
